repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
When the terminal emulator sends an OSC sequence to Nvim (as a response to another OSC sequence that was first sent by Nvim), populate the OSC sequence in the v:termresponse variable and fire the TermResponse event.

This makes use of the already documented but unimplemented TermResponse event. This event exists in Vim but is only fired when Vim receives a primary device attributes response.

Follow up items:

- Use `TermResponse` for CSI responses (this will allow us to move the kitty keyboard protocol detection out of C and into Lua)
- Move the background color detection out of C and into Lua

Fixes: https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues/25856

comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -987,12 +987,25 @@ TermClose			When a |terminal| job ends.
 				Sets these |v:event| keys:
 				    status
 							*TermResponse*
-TermResponse			After the response to t_RV is received from
-				the terminal.  The value of |v:termresponse|
-				can be used to do things depending on the
-				terminal version.  May be triggered halfway
-				through another event (file I/O, a shell
-				command, or anything else that takes time).
+TermResponse			When Nvim receives a OSC response from the
+				terminal.  Sets |v:termresposne|. When used

comment_data.body: I'd like this to be a bit more specific. Any api call sent non-blocking is already an "event". maybe `nvim_ui_term_event()` and the discriminator then could be `osc_response` (maybe we want to distinguish more custom sequences in the future)
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -524,6 +525,32 @@ void nvim_ui_pum_set_bounds(uint64_t channel_id, Float width, Float height, Floa
   ui->pum_pos = true;
 }
 
+/// Send a UI event to Nvim.
+///
+/// The following events are supported:
+///
+///   - "termresponse": TUI only. The terminal sent a OSC response sequence to Nvim. The
+///                     payload is the received OSC sequence.
+///
+/// @param channel_id
+/// @param event Event name
+/// @param payload Event payload
+/// @param[out] err Error details, if any.
+void nvim_ui_event(uint64_t channel_id, String event, Object value,

comment_data.body: Ah this was left in from an earlier draft when I was (incorrectly) firing the autocommand event from `input.c`. Will remove this in a fixup.

comment_regular_data.body:
I removed references to including CSI events in TermResponse, since there's no easy way (as far as I can tell) to get the "raw" CSI sequence as a string the way that we can for OSC sequences.

@leonerd does libtermkey have something equivalent to `termkey_interpret_string` for CSI keys that gives us the unparsed escape sequence? If not we will need to rebuild the string using the parsed representation, which might be tricky (I'm concerned about edge cases, but maybe this isn't as bad as I'm thinking).

title: feat(tui): use TermResponse event for OSC responses
